reviews.productTitle: Humpptom Light Switch, Dimmer Switch with Wireless Remote Control, Single Pole Smart Switch Support 2.4G&5G Compatible with Alexa
reviews.text: Purchased to allow remotely dimming/turning off lights from bed. Paired immediately and works great. I've had other name brands that struggled to cooperate. It's also apparently Alexa compatible, but I didn't need that. If you want the most reliable operation of this (or any) remote control, especially at greater distance, 2.4 is the way to go. You do not need the additional bandwidth 5GHz can provide in order to operate a light switch although this item does provide that frequency, and, if used in the same room as the switch, the remote should never have any trouble.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2025
reviews.title: Works out of the box

reviews.productTitle: Humpptom Light Switch, Dimmer Switch with Wireless Remote Control, Single Pole Smart Switch Support 2.4G&5G Compatible with Alexa
reviews.text: This is a very standard dimmer switch in terms of dimensions, which makes it easy to install. It has wire leads instead of screw terminals as the high-end brands. I 'was able to get them both tother in jar. Unfortunately, this device has zero safety certifications, no UL, no ETL and not even CE. So that doesn’t gives you confidence on product safety. It only has FCC certification but that one doesn’t cover safety. So keep that in mind. I wish they had their certifications since it seems like a well made product. I wish I could give them at least 4 stars but safety is very important for a device that is connected 24/7.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2025
reviews.title: Zero safety certifications

reviews.productTitle: Humpptom Light Switch, Dimmer Switch with Wireless Remote Control, Single Pole Smart Switch Support 2.4G&5G Compatible with Alexa
reviews.text: First of all- it works. Lights turn on and off, dimmer works, remote all good. But that’s all. In hindsight I would have preferred to spend $20 more and get a name brand dimmer. -the wiring and the directions are NOT correct. The labels on the actual wires for “load”, “neutral”, “ground” do NOT match the colors and descriptions on the instructions. Extremely odd, and for someone with only a basic knowledge and comfort level in electrical work this really was not a fun experience installing. I had to trace around the wires on my wall and watch a few videos and really just make my best guess. -the actual wall unit and remote just feel cheap. Light plastic, not super flush and tight, creaks when a button is pressed… and you have to “push the buttons correctly”- hard and to the right. Lol. If you don’t, they don’t work. You could be sitting there pushing away with no result. It supposedly works with Amazon Alexa, although I have not tried it and don’t know how that would work anyway. Based on my experience so far it’s likely more trouble than it’s worth. I also don’t feel a need to verbally turn off my lights when I have a remote and also legs. These issues are the core of what matters for a dimmer switch other then “if it works”. So yes, it works. But assuming you don’t want to shut off your power and swap out light switches multiple times, just get a better one.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2024
reviews.title: Works, but not amazing.

reviews.productTitle: Humpptom Light Switch, Dimmer Switch with Wireless Remote Control, Single Pole Smart Switch Support 2.4G&5G Compatible with Alexa
reviews.text: Very inconvenient as the power comes on full power after a power failure and must be manually turned off. This is a real problem if you are not at home or away for an extended time.

reviews.productTitle: Humpptom Light Switch, Dimmer Switch with Wireless Remote Control, Single Pole Smart Switch Support 2.4G&5G Compatible with Alexa
reviews.text: Attaching the wiring according to the rear of the device I found the hot and neutral wires mislabeled after it was installed (and not working). I then connected it the way it should be and the switch will turn the light on dim. Then when you press the {-} switch the light goes to full bright before you can turn it back down. This is one of the poorest devices I have ever wired. I would suggest going to Home Depot and getting a regular dimming switch because this device is not worth the money or the time to install it.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2024
reviews.title: Poor instructions could be dangerous!

reviews.productTitle: Humpptom Light Switch, Dimmer Switch with Wireless Remote Control, Single Pole Smart Switch Support 2.4G&5G Compatible with Alexa
reviews.text: Attractive looking, with attractive price. Solves the problem of remote control of a single pole switch from any number of other locations without wiring. The remotes look good, like the more expensive pico remotes, and allow dimming at the remote. They fit nicely in a decora opening and seem to work reliably. However, there are some serious quirks. First of all, realize that this device only works with Alexa. It cannot be controlled with any other mobile app like most other wifi device. For example no control with Tuya or SmarLife apps like many chinese devices sold on Amazon can be. Secondly, when power goes out and comes back on, these switches will turn the light on which will stay on till you turn it off. This created a problem for me as I was installing the switch at a remote home where I am not there all the time, and we lose power there a lot. Without an app to control it, I can't turn things off after a power outage and the lights stay on till we visit the house again weeks later. This should not be the normal behavior and the switch should either revert to off or to its pre-outage state. Additionally, I don't use Alexa and it does not provide easy scheduling controls like other mobile apps.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
reviews.title: Some show-stopping quirks

reviews.productTitle: Humpptom Light Switch, Dimmer Switch with Wireless Remote Control, Single Pole Smart Switch Support 2.4G&5G Compatible with Alexa
reviews.text: Per instruction- red to the line, blue to the load, white- neutral, and green to ground. No light in the switch with correct wiring. Then flipped the line and load- light in the switch but not light at the load. After trial and error, decided that it's a dud and returning it.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
reviews.title: Didn't work right out of the box

reviews.productTitle: Humpptom Light Switch, Dimmer Switch with Wireless Remote Control, Single Pole Smart Switch Support 2.4G&5G Compatible with Alexa
reviews.text: So first there were differences on support for Google, it doesn't have it! Second it says 5g support which is really what I wanted but it doesn't support 5g. Now for the rest it work perfectly, it cheap enough price wise, but Alexa found the units with zero issues. It was quick and easy install. I do have one issue that I will work on thinking it might be the bulbs but at full power the light bulbs flicker, but all other settings work great. So we shall see the other lights have not had an issue yet. No app to download so that was a nice plus.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2024
reviews.title: Good switch

reviews.productTitle: Humpptom Light Switch, Dimmer Switch with Wireless Remote Control, Single Pole Smart Switch Support 2.4G&5G Compatible with Alexa
reviews.text: This single pole smart switch and remote set, works well in several configurations to add additional functionality and smart capabilities to your existing single pole or 3 way light switches. The instructions for single pole are straightforward, but it can get very complex when converting an existing 3way switch, so this single pole plus remote, you essentially have to disable/bypass one switch of the 3way circuit and place and use the remote as though it was the other switch in the circuit. Once completed, it looks like a much more expensive well known brand of smart switch, and Alexa learns it's presence once power is reconnected. On/off and dimming functions work via voice command and button input on the switch or remote, but every so often, the remote will fail to connect and all buttons will be unresponsive with no LED's illuminated. Cycling the light off then off again usually corrects this error, but it happens frequently enough to be an annoyance. Also this switch cannot be controlled by Google or anything but Alexa so keep your personal ecosystem in mind when getting this, but if you don't mind those small annoyances this is a great affordable smart light switch for you.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2024
reviews.title: Good quality smart switch, some drawbacks.

reviews.text: I received a dud. The switch is wired correctly (I am an electrical engineer and certified master electrician). The lights immediately came on dim when the switch was off. I tested turning it on and off and adjusting the dimmer up and down. I measured 43 volts (load to neutral) no matter what settings I tried. I will send this back and will try again. If the second attempt disappoints me, I'm done with this product.

reviews.title: Got a dud - puts out 43 volts all on or off
